pageContext.claim: “I think it was a major violation. I think we would have had a deal [with Iran] if it wasn't for John Kerry.”
pageContext.analysis: A total fantasy. Kerry, the former secretary of state under President Barack Obama, said he had one conversation with the Iranian foreign minister in Germany after Trump withdrew the United States from the Iran nuclear deal. He denied any inappropriate contacts. The Trump administration has not sought to negotiate a new deal with Iran.
